actions.committee: House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

official_title: A bill to further amend the International Travel Act of 1961, as amended.

summary.text: Provides that the Secretary of Commerce may: (1) set and collect fees or charges for admissions, concessions, services, and space at any travel exposition, fair, or exhibit in such an amount as to defray, in whole or in part, the costs directly related to the establishment, operation, maintenance, and dismantlement of such exhibition, fair, or exhibit; and (2) charge for any promotional publications and materials relating to travel and tourism. Authorizes to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of this Act. (Amends 22 U.S.C. 2123)

titles.title: A bill to further amend the International Travel Act of 1961, as amended.
